TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is represented before the Court by Mr PERSON , a law professor at ORG . The respondent Government are represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , Director in ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties and as they appear from the documents , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE lawyer PERSON submitted to ORG ( käräjäoikeus , tingsrätten ) of GPE an application for a summons against QUANTITY persons , including the applicant ( also a lawyer ) , requesting their punishment for alleged false denunciation “ despite better knowledge ” ( vastoin parempaa tietoa tehty perätön ilmianto , osann angivelse emot bättre vetande ) and defamation “ despite better knowledge ” ( vastoin parempaa tietoa tehty herjaus , smädelse emot bättre vetande ) on several counts , and demanding damages . PERSON alleged that the applicant had participated in a campaign of false accusations against him , allegedly caused by the fact that PERSON had tried to recover unpaid fees from his former clients .

In an appended indictment ( including charge no . CARDINAL ) PERSON demanded the punishment of the applicant on CARDINAL counts of alleged false denunciation and CARDINAL counts of alleged defamation committed “ despite better knowledge ” . PERSON alleged that , on DATE , while representing PERSON the applicant had reported an offence against ORG alleging aggravated fraud , aggravated extortion ( kiristys , utpressning ) , misuse of a position of trust ( luottamusaseman väärinkäyttö , missbruk av förtroendeställning ) and forgery . According to PERSON , the applicant , in his report of offences , had claimed that PERSON had overcharged CARDINAL of his clients , intentionally lost his GPE cases and caused them damage , and forged the signatures of his clients to several powers of attorney . A public prosecutor had on DATE waived charges against PERSON

In another appended indictment ( including charge no . CARDINAL ) PERSON demanded the punishment of the applicant on CARDINAL counts of alleged false denunciation and CARDINAL counts of alleged defamation “ despite better knowledge ” . PERSON alleged that , on DATE , while representing several of his clients the applicant had reported an offence against PERSON and accused PERSON of several offences , namely forgery , misuse of a position of trust , breach of consumer credit regulations ( kulutusluottorikos , konsumentkreditbrott ) , slander and profanation of the memory of a deceased person ( kuolleen miehen muiston häpäiseminen , skymfande av död mans minne ) . PERSON also accused the applicant of having given false information and putting forward false allegations against PERSON in the pre - trial investigations following the applicant ’s report to the police . A public prosecutor had on DATE waived part of the charges against ORG Based on the remaining issues in the reports of offences submitted by the applicant , a public prosecutor had lodged charges of embezzlement and attempted fraud against PERSON

On DATE ORG served a writ of summons on the applicant . It noted that it had transferred the examination of the indictments against CARDINAL co - defendants to separate criminal proceedings which were pending at the same time . The applicant received the summons on DATE .

On DATE ORG held the first hearing , in which PERSON ’s indictment was considered . A public prosecutor , present at the hearing , did not support the charges . The applicant was not present due to a holiday trip abroad , of which he had informed ORG in advance . The case was adjourned at PERSON ’s request . The court imposed a conditional fine on the applicant in order to obtain his attendance . The second hearing took place on DATE . The case was adjourned as CARDINAL of the CARDINAL presiding judges had become disqualified .

On DATE the third hearing was held . The applicant contested the charges disputing the alleged facts and requested that these proceedings should follow the pending criminal proceedings against PERSON concerning the embezzlement and fraud in order for the facts to be better established . The applicant maintained that he had reported the offences against PERSON on his GPE , i.e. ORG , instructions , after verifying the facts with his clients and becoming convinced of the probable existence of reasons to suspect the offences . PERSON requested an adjournment , to which the applicant did not object .
The fourth hearing took place on DATE . The case was adjourned at PERSON ’s request .

The fifth hearing was held on DATE , when the case was adjourned with the agreement of all parties in anticipation of the outcome of the criminal proceedings against PERSON , which were now pending before the same ORG .

On DATE ORG dismissed the charges of alleged embezzlement and fraud against K .. Upon appeal , ORG ( hovioikeus , hovrätten ) of ORG upheld the judgment on DATE , and finally , on DATE , ORG ( korkein oikeus , högsta domstolen ) refused leave to appeal .

On DATE the applicant submitted his observations to ORG in reply to PERSON ’s written statements of CARDINAL and DATE . According to the applicant , in his letter of CARDINAL DATE PERSON “ renewed his requests and the description of the alleged offences in broad outline . ”
According to the applicant , on DATE ORG sent a memorandum to the parties , which included PERSON ’s indictment , corresponding to his application for a summons on DATE .

A preparatory hearing was held on DATE , in which the applicant was not present . At that hearing ORG prepared the examination of the criminal proceedings instigated by PERSON , as well as another set of criminal proceedings instigated at some point by CARDINAL of the applicant ’s co - defendants against K .. PERSON repeated his indictment as regards the allegedly unlawful reports of offences submitted by the applicant on DATE and DATE . The applicant ’s written observations , contesting these charges ( see above ) , were included in the minutes of the preparatory hearing .
On page TIME of the preparatory hearing it was stated :
“ PERSON specified that his indictment was based on those acts that the defendants had committed prior to the public prosecutor ’s decision not to lodge charges . ”

ORG main hearing was held on DATE on DATE and DATE . The applicant was present on DATE , partially present on DATE ( with the court ’s consent ) , and again present during the entire hearing of DATE .

According to TIME of the main hearing ( on pp . CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) , PERSON presented alternative charges of defamation “ without better knowledge ” ( ei vastoin parempaa tietoa tehty herjaus , smädelse dock icke emot bättre vetande ) i.e. negligent defamation , to be distinguished from defamation “ despite better knowledge ” , that is to say , intentionally imputing an offence to PERSON whilst knowing that he had not committed it ( rather than voicing a mere suspicion that he had ) .
On DATE the main hearing the charge no . CARDINAL was particularised , insofar as relevant , as follows :

“ [ A co - defendant H. ] represented / advised / urged by [ the applicant ] and [ the applicant ] , have in a report of an offence drawn up by [ the applicant ] on DATE , which report was received by ORG on DATE , and in the subsequent pre - trial investigations , despite without better knowledge ... . ”
On page TIME of the main hearing , it was further noted in connection with charge no . CARDINAL that :
“ PERSON has based his indictment on all those acts that the defendants have committed in connection with the reports of offences prior to the public prosecutor ’s decision not to lodge charges . ”

On DATE the ORG delivered its judgment . It dismissed all charges concerning false denunciation . According to ORG , the applicant had not deliberately given false information to the police . It convicted the applicant of defamation committed “ without better knowledge ” . As to the first set charges ( charge CARDINAL ) the court found that the applicant ’s allegations presented in his final statement of DATE to the police had been harmful to PERSON and not been proven to be correct . ORG further ruled that the applicant had in the final statement demanded that PERSON be charged with those offences reported by his clients , and that at that point he had at his disposal the entire pre - trial investigation report , and could therefore not rely entirely on his clients’ assertions . As regards the second set of charges of defamation ( charge no . CARDINAL ) ORG found , inter alia , that the applicant had submitted to the police final statements of CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE in which he had alleged that PERSON was guilty of the offences reported on DATE . ORG noted that at that point the applicant had at his disposal the entire pre - trial investigation report . It also took into account a report of an offence drawn up by the applicant on CARDINAL DATE on his GPE behalf . It found that the applicant , as a lawyer , should have been aware of the groundlessness of the allegations of forgery and misuse of a position of trust , and had , thus , committed defamation “ without better knowledge ” .

ORG sentenced the applicant to DATE - fines , amounting to MONEY ( ORG ; corresponding to MONEY ( ORG ) ) and ordered him to pay , separately and jointly with a co - defendant , damages of LAW ( EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) and legal expenses of LAW ( ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) plus interest , and , separately , damages of ORG plus interest .

On DATE the applicant appealed against the entire judgment to ORG of ORG , complaining under LAW ( a ) of the LAW that ORG had convicted him of offences with which he had not been charged and requesting , inter alia , an oral hearing . According to the applicant , PERSON ’s indictment was insufficiently specified and had demanded punishment for defamation “ despite better knowledge ” whereas ORG had convicted him of defamation “ without better knowledge ” , thus depriving him of a chance to defend himself . The applicant maintained that , despite ORG minutes , PERSON had not presented alternative charges of “ without better knowledge ” during the principal hearing , and that had this occurred while he was absent on DATE , it was in any case prohibited .

Further , the applicant complained that the final statements submitted by him to the police on DATE ( charge no . CARDINAL ) and on DATE ( charge no . CARDINAL ) were not mentioned in the indictments and that he had , thus , not been charged with defamation in those regards . According to the applicant , ORG conviction was entirely based on these final statements , which deprived him of a chance to defend himself . The applicant emphasised that PERSON ’s indictment relied only on his reports of offences of CARDINAL DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE .

The applicant put forward that he had submitted the final statements to the police following the normal proceedings pursuant to section CARDINAL of the Act on ORG ( esitutkintalaki , förundersökninglag ; DATE ) and not with the intent of offending PERSON maintained , inter alia , that he had not alleged PERSON ’s guilt beyond what PERSON had himself admitted in the pre - trial investigations , and that he was entitled to rely on his clients’ instructions and assertions . He had in fact in both cases requested the police to continue their investigations . He maintained that as the police had conducted CARDINAL further witness interrogations and other investigative measures after his final statements , he did not have at his disposal the entire pre - trial investigation reports as ORG had , according to the applicant , wrongly held . He also complained that punishing legal counsel for pursuing their GPE cases would impede the ORG actions .
The applicant further maintained that the presiding judge had allowed PERSON to insult him during the trial several times which disclosed bias and rendered the trial unfair .

On DATE ORG , without having held an oral hearing , upheld ORG judgment , accepting its reasons and upholding the applicant ’s conviction and sentence . It however reduced his overall damage liabilities to ORG ( EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) and ordered him to reimburse ORG legal expenses in ORG jointly and separately with a co - defendant by ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) . It ordered the parties to bear their own legal expenses in ORG .
On DATE ORG PERSON asianajajaliitto , PERSON ) informed the applicant that it had commenced disciplinary proceedings against him .
On DATE the applicant sought leave to appeal and appealed to ORG expressing his dissatisfaction with the outcome and reasoning of the appellate court ’s judgment .
On DATE ORG refused the applicant leave to appeal .

Section CARDINAL of LAW ( perustuslaki , grundagen ; GPE ) provides that everyone has the freedom of expression . Freedom of expression entails the right to express , disseminate and receive information , opinions and other communications without prior prevention by anyone . More detailed provisions on the exercise of the freedom of expression are laid down by an LAW .

LAW , section CARDINAL of the Code of Judicial Procedure ( oikeudenkäymiskaari , rättegångsbalk ; CARDINAL ) , as in force at the relevant time , provided that a public prosecutor was to present his / her requests and their grounds at the beginning of the trial . Unless there were pressing reasons , the same applied to the victim .

LAW , section CARDINAL of the Code on Criminal Procedure ( laki oikeudenkäynnistä rikosasioissa , lag om rättegång i brottmål ; CARDINAL ) , as subsequently in force , provides that a served indictment may not be changed . A public prosecutor may , however , expand the indictment to include another alleged offence , provided that the court finds it appropriate . Subsection CARDINAL of the section provides that to restrict the charges or to rely on another legal provision or a new fact is not regarded as expanding the charge .

Section CARDINAL of the Act on ORG ( esitutkintalaki , förundersökningslagen ; DATE ) provides that the police must give the parties an opportunity to submit their final statements concerning the material gathered in the pre - trial investigations , if such a statement is liable to expedite or facilitate the examination of the case in a court . The final statement must be attached to TIME of the pre - trial investigations .

LAW , section CARDINAL of LAW ( rikoslaki , strafflagen ) as in force at the relevant time , provided that a person alleging , albeit contrary to his or her better knowledge , that someone had committed an offence was to be convicted of defamation , unless he or she could show probable cause in support of the allegation .

According to LAW , as in force at the relevant time , a person alleging , albeit not contrary to his or her better knowledge , that someone had committed an offence was to be convicted of defamation , unless he or she could show probable cause in support of the allegation .
